BERTS2S: gunmen have attacked two offices in the turkish capital, istanbul, killing two people and injuring several other people.
BERTS2S_lines: gunmen have attacked two offices in the turkish capital, istanbul, killing two people and injuring several other people.
TConvS2S: two people have been killed and two others injured in a fire at a house in istanbul, turkish police say.
TConvS2S_lines: two people have been killed and two others injured in a fire at a house in istanbul, turkish police say.
PtGen: at least 10 people have been killed in a fire at a building site in istanbul, police say.

TranS2S: turkish president recep tayyip erdogan has said fire broke out at offices in istanbul\'s capital, istanbul.
TranS2S_lines: turkish president recep tayyip erdogan has said fire broke out at offices in istanbul\'s capital, istanbul.
article: The daily Yeni Safak said its offices and those of Yeni Akit were attacked. No casualties were reported.It said four masked assailants attacked the Yeni Safak building. Firefighters quickly extinguished the blaze.Police have cordoned off the area around the building.The two papers support the governing AK Party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.The Yeni Akit offices are 20km (12 miles) away from the Yeni Safak building, and the night-time attacks happened almost at the same time, early on Thursday.Windows in both buildings were shattered by the gunfire, Istanbul police said."Numerous spent bullet casings were also found at both scenes," the police added. They are now hunting the assailants.So far no group has claimed it was behind the attacks.Last September, pro-government protesters attacked the offices of the daily Hurriyet, accusing the paper of misquoting President Erdogan.
article_lines: The daily Yeni Safak said its offices and those of Yeni Akit were attacked.
It said four masked assailants attacked the Yeni Safak building.
Police have cordoned off the area around the building.
The two papers support the governing AK Party of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
The Yeni Akit offices are 20km (12 miles) away from the Yeni Safak building, and the night-time attacks happened almost at the same time, early on Thursday.
Windows in both buildings were shattered by the gunfire, Istanbul police said.
"Numerous spent bullet casings were also found at both scenes," the police added.
They are now hunting the assailants.
So far no group has claimed it was behind the attacks.
Last September, pro-government protesters attacked the offices of the daily Hurriyet, accusing the paper of misquoting President Erdogan.
traps: he spent 14 years as a player at rangers, before returning as a coach in 2005.durrant held several positions in the youth set-up, then stepped up to work with the first team during walter smith's second spell as manager in 2007.he was first-team coach when ally mccoist succeeded smith in 2011, then returned to working with the youths again after mccoist resigned during season 2014-15.

reference: unidentified assailants have hurled petrol bombs and fired shots at the istanbul offices of two staunchly pro-government turkish newspapers, the papers and the police say.
